meanings.definition: The quality or state of being capable of being sold.
meanings.sent1: The vendor was pleased with the high vendibilities of his products.
meanings.sent2: The new packaging increased the vendibilities of the items on the shelves.
meanings.sent3: The quirky design of the product added to its vendibilities, making it stand out.
meanings.sent4: Her charm and charisma gave her resume a boost in vendibilities.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors and catchy slogans enhanced the vendibilities of the merchandise.

meanings.definition: The marketability or attractiveness of a product for sale.
meanings.sent1: The company's success was due to the high vendibilities of their products.
meanings.sent2: Understanding consumer preferences is crucial for increasing vendibilities.
meanings.sent3: The unique scent of the perfume added to its vendibilities, attracting more customers.
meanings.sent4: The celebrity endorsement significantly boosted the vendibilities of the brand.
meanings.sent5: The strategic pricing strategy improved the vendibilities of the product in the competitive market.
